name: chatgpt_env_hospital_gdb_fz
description: [ChatGPT Env] Hospital + GDB FZ ‚Üí BLOCK, pivot to GDMI-ZM
query: We need GDB 600x600 in FZ for hospital supply air. 3400 m¬≥/h.

turns.content: We need GDB 600x600 in FZ for hospital supply air. 3400 m¬≥/h.

For the hospital project, the requested GDB housing is not suitable for the hospital environment due to hygiene requirements.The GDB housing has a corrosion class of C2 and uses single-wall uninsulated construction, which does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for hospital environments.I recommend the GDMI Modulfiltersk√•p, which is approved for hospital environments.

gemini.explanation: The system correctly identified a critical engineering mismatch between the requested product (GDB) and the application (hospital supply air). It accurately cited the product's construction features from the catalog (single-wall, uninsulated, C2) to justify why it is unsuitable for hygiene-critical environments, recommending the superior GDMI alternative instead.

dimension_explanations.correctness: Correctly identifies GDB as single-wall, uninsulated, and corrosion class C2 (verified PDF p.8).
dimension_explanations.completeness: Addresses the safety/suitability issue immediately; while it didn't provide the GDMI product card yet, blocking the unsafe request is the priority.
dimension_explanations.safety: Excellent risk awareness; correctly blocks an uninsulated, difficult-to-clean housing for a hospital application where hygiene and condensation control are critical.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Sound engineering logic connecting physical product attributes (uninsulated/single-wall) to application requirements (hygiene).
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Strictly adheres to best-practice engineering constraints regarding hospital ventilation.

strengths: Accurate extraction of GDB construction details (uninsulated, single-wall) from PDF
Strong engineering judgment regarding hospital hygiene requirements
weaknesses: Could have proactively offered the specific GDMI 600x600 configuration in the same response to save a turn
pdf_citations: GDMI construction: 'v√§rme- och kondensisolerat... dubbelmantlat' (PDF p.11)

openai.explanation: The system correctly steers away from GDB for a hospital supply-air context, but it justifies the block with incorrect catalog-based claims (corrosion class and leakage/hygiene assertions) and fails to provide a properly sized GDMI alternative product card. It also conflates insulation/corrosion/leakage with ‚Äúhospital approval‚Äù without asking key hygiene and installation parameters.

dimension_explanations.correctness: PDF check: GDB 600x600 has Fl√∂de 3400 m¬≥/h and weights 27 kg (550/600) and 34 kg (750/800), but the system incorrectly states GDB is C2 (catalog states GDB is usually galvanized and marked C2 for the housing section, while the material page states FZ Z275 is C3) and incorrectly claims it does not meet leakage class despite the catalog stating the series is tested to EN 15727/EN 1886; engineering-wise, preferring an insulated modular housing (GDMI) for hospital supply air can be sound but is not proven by the provided claims.
dimension_explanations.completeness: It blocks GDB but does not specify a GDMI size/length/material to meet 3400 m¬≥/h, nor does it ask for hygiene class, location (indoor/outdoor), cleaning regime, or required leakage class.
dimension_explanations.safety: It avoids a potentially non-hygienic choice for hospital supply air, but the warning rationale is muddled and could mislead about actual compliance criteria (EN 15727/EN 1886 vs hospital hygiene requirements).
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional and direct, appropriate for technical sales support.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Reasoning has a plausible direction (hospital supply air ‚Üí higher hygiene/cleanability ‚Üí better housing), but it makes unsupported leaps ("approved for hospital") and mixes up corrosion/leakage/insulation arguments.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: It violates catalog constraints by asserting GDB fails leakage class/hygiene when the catalog explicitly states EN 15727/EN 1886 testing; it also fails the expected workflow of providing a correctly sized alternative (GDMI 600x600 at 3400 m¬≥/h) once it blocks the requested item.

strengths: Appropriately cautious about using a basic single-wall duct filter housing for hospital supply air.
Points to a more robust modular/insulated family (GDMI) that is commonly preferred in higher-hygiene AHU sections.
weaknesses: Incorrect/unsupported compliance statements: claims GDB doesn‚Äôt meet leakage/hygiene requirements despite EN 15727/EN 1886 testing being stated in the catalog.
No actionable alternative selection (no GDMI size/length/material, no product card, no follow-up questions on hygiene/leakage/cleanability requirements).
pdf_citations: GDB 600x600: Fl√∂de = 3400 m¬≥/h; weights 34 kg (750/800) and 27 kg (550/600) (GDB M√ÖTT table, PDF page showing GDB dimensions/flow).
Catalog states the filtersk√•psserie is tested for leakage through casing, strength and bypass leakage per EN 15727:2010 and EN 1886:2007 (SORTIMENT page).

content_segments.text: For the hospital project, the requested GDB housing is not suitable for the hospital environment due to hygiene requirements.
The GDB housing has a corrosion class of C2 and uses single-wall uninsulated construction, which does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for hospital environments.
content_segments.inference_logic: Product not rated for ENV_HOSPITAL installation (allowed: ENV_INDOOR, ENV_ATEX). This product uses SINGLE_WALL_UNINSULATED construction which does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for this environment.

content_segments.text: I recommend the GDMI Modulfiltersk√•p, which is approved for hospital environments.
